title: Liverpool defender Mamadou Sakho joins Crystal Palace on loan for the rest of the season
text:
Liverpool defender Mamadou Sakho joins Crystal Palace on loan for the rest of the season The Frenchman has finally sealed his Anfield exit after the Eagles thrashed out terms for the centre-back Share Sakho has left Liverpool for Selhurst Park (Photo: David Price) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Liverpool defender Mamadou Sakho has joined Crystal Palace on loan for the remainder of the season. 
The Frenchman was sent home from the Reds' pre-season tour of the USA and has not featured for the first team over the course of the campaign so far. 
Spartak Moscow, Galatasaray, Swansea and Southampton were also interested in his services, but he has signed for Palace instead on a temporary deal until the end of this season. 
The Eagles stumped up a £2million loan fee and will cover Sakho's loan for the duration of the deal. Read More All the latest news, gossip and done deals in the final hours of the January window Sakho hasn't featured for the first team this season (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty Images) 
Sakho gave a brief interview to French publication L'Equipe this morning saying he needed time to assess his options. 
Liverpool would want their money back, even though the France international has not played a senior game of football since April 20 of last year, due initially to an adverse doping finding, and then the disagreement with Klopp. 
Meanwhile, Palace have also swooped to sign Serbian midfielder Luka Milivojevic from Olympiacos for an undisclosed fee. Read More Liverpool 1-1 Chelsea: Simon Mignolet's late penalty save stops the Reds' rot - 5 things we learned 
Sam Allardyce said: “I am delighted to bring Luka to the club. He has experience in UEFA Champions League and International football and will add a new dimension to our midfield. 
"He is a talented two footed player with intelligent passing ability as well as being very strong defensively, in and out of possession.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
